teams.name: Kiva Muslims
teams.loan_because:
002.271 Yusuf Ali Translation:
If ye disclose (acts of) charity, even so it is well, but if ye conceal them, and make them reach those (really) in need, that is best for you: It will remove from you some of your (stains of) evil. And Allah is well acquainted with what ye do.
teams.description: Insha'Allah our team will be a collaboration of people from all walks of life united by one goal: to help those less fortunate and displaying great appreciation to our creator for blessing us to help make a differerence in the world.

teams.name: HP
teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. Itâ€™s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Holy Cow! - High-Impact Loan Lenders
teams.loan_because: We want to make the largest impact that can be made with a microloan. High-Impact Loan Lenders was formed to share news of the availability of great loans with other lenders. It is expected that lenders will continue to credit loans to other teams.
teams.description:
Pretty much every loan on Kiva is a good loan. At High-Impact Loan Lenders, we are interested in the very best loans.

It's hard to define an exact criteria for the loans in which we are interested, but there will not be very many of them. We look for loans that practically make us jump out of our chair and exclaim "Holy cow! What a great loan!" If a loan is so good that it makes you say "Forget about the budget -- I have 25 bucks for THAT loan!" it is a loan in which we would be interested. Looking at the loans that we've supported will give you an idea of the loans that we like.

teams.name: Free Markets and Peace
teams.loan_because: free markets are the ground work for peace.
teams.description:
Peace and not war is the father of all things... Whoever wants peace among nations must seek to limit the state and its influence most strictly... The philosophy of protectionism is a philosophy of war... The liberal does not expect to abolish war by preaching and moralizing. He seeks to create the 
social conditions that will eliminate the causes of war.... Ludwig von Mises; economist, philosopher, writer (1881 - 1973).

teams.name: Food Matters - Vegetarians, Vegans, Raw and Friends

teams.description:

teams.description: Free markets, free minds. Hayek, Mises, Friedman.

teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

DoSomething.org spearheads national campaigns so 13- to 25-year-olds can make an impact - without ever needing money, an adult, or a car. Over 2.4 million people took action through DoSomething.org in 2012. Why? Because apathy sucks.

teams.name: Candles for Dads
teams.loan_because: Dads are the best. We make loans to support hard-working dads, in memory of great dads passed.
teams.description:
When our dad passed from a sudden heart attack, we asked friends to light a candle in his memory. We received photos of candles from around the world, which provided comfort. This Kiva lending team is a virtual candle we're lighting in memory of great dads everywhere - their light and love will live on.

...................

HOW TO LOAN WITH OUR KIVA TEAM:

1. Join Kiva, then join our "Candles for Dads" Lending Team.
2. After you've joined our Lending Team, find a dad on Kiva to loan to and make a loan of $25 or more.
3. During checkout, select to have your loan count towards our "Candles for Dads" Kiva Team's collective impact. Thanks!

HOW TO FIND DADS ON KIVA TO LOAN TO:
1. Find a Featured Candles for Dads loan on our Team Activity page, or on our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/candlesfordads
2. Search for new dads to support on Kiva by clicking "Lend" in the Kiva main menu, then filter your search by gender and read profiles to find dads to loan to. Share your finds with us on facebook so we chip in as a group (we're still a small group, so plan to feature 1-2 loans a month for now). 
...................

HELP SHARE CANDLES FOR DADS:
1. Please connect with us on Facebook & Twitter and invite friends to join us:
Facebook: http://facebook.com/candlesfordads
Twitter: http://twitter.com/candlesfordads
Website: http://candlesfordads.org (forwards to Kiva Team Page)
2. Recruit friends to join our Kiva Lending Team. Kiva has some cool recruiting tools that (sometimes) even give you and friends who join a $25 credit to make loans when they join: http://www.kiva.org/team/CandlesForDads/recruit 
3. Volunteer Research for Dad Loan Suggestions: If you find a great dad on Kiva for us to loan to, share the Kiva profiles on our facebook page so others on our team can chip in to reach the goal. We will feature at least one C4D loan each month.
4. Share a memory of a great dad you are donating in memory of on our facebook and twitter.
......................

In memory of our dad, Shaman Mullick (1947 - 2012), and great dads everywhere. Your love and light live on.

teams.name: Armenia
teams.loan_because: we want to be part of a global community that aims to sustainably alleviate poverty
teams.description:
The Armenia Team currently has 90 members supporting Armenian entrepreneurs. 

Whether they make cheese, herd sheep, sell shoes, or grow tomatoes, our team exists to support them in getting access to affordable loans all over Armenia.
 
Past and Present Kiva Fellows Serving in Armenia:

- Velizara Passajova KF8
- Brian Kelly KF9
- Suzanne Till KF9
- Alexis Ohanian KF10
- Liz Nagle KF10
- Peter Tashjian KF11
- Vanick Der Bedrossian KF12
- Abhishek Banerjee KF13
- Caree Edson KF14

As Kiva Fellows, we are here to support Kiva lending in Armenia. We will update team members with interesting news, and gladly answer any questions you may have.

Happy lending, and Go Team Armenia!

You can check out our field partners:
SEF International here: http://www.kiva.org/partners/169
and Nor Horizon here:
http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=146&_tpg=fb

teams.loan_because:
This is a unique opportunity for HP employees globally to actively participate in driving HP Living Progress by supporting thousands of entrepreneurs around the world who need access to capital to start or grow their business. HP Living Progress is the framework for how we do business. Itâ€™s how we use our people and technologies to create a world where everyone has the opportunity to progress. 

Through this innovative collaboration with Kiva and the HP Company Foundation we can help ensure that entrepreneurs around the world achieve their dreams.
teams.description: Our team is committed to changing a million lives, and helping to end extreme poverty, one loan at a time.

teams.name: Be a Better Bank
teams.loan_because: Our goal is to create micro-financing opportunities to people in need- specifically in Ukraine. We believe in volunteerism and in supporting local entrepreneurs to a difference in their own lives and strengthen their community. We are working to create a network that can leverage resources and help Peace Corps Volunteers make even more of a difference in Ukraine.
teams.description: We are Peace Corps Volunteers who currently or previously served in Ukraine, as well as like minded family and friends. We loan to Ukrainian entrepreneurs to broaden our scope in developing individual skills and developing communities across the country.

teams.name: Candles for Dads
teams.loan_because: Dads are the best. We make loans to support hard-working dads, in memory of great dads passed.
teams.description:
When our dad passed from a sudden heart attack, we asked friends to light a candle in his memory. We received photos of candles from around the world, which provided comfort. This Kiva lending team is a virtual candle we're lighting in memory of great dads everywhere - their light and love will live on.

...................

HOW TO LOAN WITH OUR KIVA TEAM:

1. Join Kiva, then join our "Candles for Dads" Lending Team.
2. After you've joined our Lending Team, find a dad on Kiva to loan to and make a loan of $25 or more.
3. During checkout, select to have your loan count towards our "Candles for Dads" Kiva Team's collective impact. Thanks!

HOW TO FIND DADS ON KIVA TO LOAN TO:
1. Find a Featured Candles for Dads loan on our Team Activity page, or on our Facebook page: www.facebook.com/candlesfordads
2. Search for new dads to support on Kiva by clicking "Lend" in the Kiva main menu, then filter your search by gender and read profiles to find dads to loan to. Share your finds with us on facebook so we chip in as a group (we're still a small group, so plan to feature 1-2 loans a month for now). 
...................

HELP SHARE CANDLES FOR DADS:
1. Please connect with us on Facebook & Twitter and invite friends to join us:
Facebook: http://facebook.com/candlesfordads
Twitter: http://twitter.com/candlesfordads
Website: http://candlesfordads.org (forwards to Kiva Team Page)
2. Recruit friends to join our Kiva Lending Team. Kiva has some cool recruiting tools that (sometimes) even give you and friends who join a $25 credit to make loans when they join: http://www.kiva.org/team/CandlesForDads/recruit 
3. Volunteer Research for Dad Loan Suggestions: If you find a great dad on Kiva for us to loan to, share the Kiva profiles on our facebook page so others on our team can chip in to reach the goal. We will feature at least one C4D loan each month.
4. Share a memory of a great dad you are donating in memory of on our facebook and twitter.
......................

In memory of our dad, Shaman Mullick (1947 - 2012), and great dads everywhere. Your love and light live on.

teams.name: DoSomething
teams.loan_because: DoSomething.org is the countryâ€™s largest not-for-profit for young people and social change. We have 1,666,208 members (and counting) who kick ass on causes they care about. Bullying. Animal cruelty. Homelessness. Cancer. The list goes on. DoSomething.org spearheads national campaigns so 13- to 25-year-olds can make an impact - without ever needing money, an adult, or a car. Over 2.4 million people took action through DoSomething.org in 2012. Why? Because apathy sucks.

teams.name: Fans of FundaciÃ³n ESPOIR
teams.loan_because: Small loans can make a big difference.
teams.description: We want to support clients of ESPOIR, one of Kiva's Ecuadorian Field Partners! We beileve in ESPOIR's mission to empower Ecuadorian women through village bank membership, giving clients access to small loans, savings accounts, health education and business training.

teams.name: Friends of Pro Mujer Bolivia
teams.loan_because: We want to support the businesses of the women who live in El Alto, Bolivia
teams.description: We loan to clients of Pro Mujer Bolivia, mainly women who own shops, stalls and workshops in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. Many are migrants from the countryside who have come to the city to improve the lives of their families.

teams.name: Unitarian Universalists
teams.loan_because:
We believe in:
**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large
**The goal of world community with peace, liberty, and justice for all
**Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.
teams.description:
We are UU congregations and individuals (including those who describe themselves as "active" or "backslid" or "interested friends" or "just looking") throughout the world. 
For more information on us, or to find a congregation near you, check out the main website for the Unitarian Universalist Association

teams.name: India
teams.loan_because: "What we should aim at is the creation of people power, which is opposed to the power of violence and is different from the coercive power of state." - Vinoba Bhave
teams.description:
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty.

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe. We love India - therefore we are the Kiva Team India. We love to use the Kiva concept to provide loans in India ! http://www.kiva.org/india

Funding loans from India: http://www.kiva.org/lend?countries=IN

http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva/2012/08/15/kiva-launches-in-india.html

Bullying. Animal cruelty. Homelessness. Cancer. The list goes on. DoSomething.org spearheads national campaigns so 13- to 25-year-olds can make an impact - without ever needing money, an adult, or a car. Over 2.4 million people took action through DoSomething.org in 2012. Why? Because apathy sucks.
